name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
July Read: Dalit Kitchens of Marathwada by Shahu Patole
We assure you that you will relish every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: Screen Craft 1.0 - Screenplay Writing Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and MWM MOVIES cordially invite you to the latest Screenplay Writing Workshop in town. 
Our Screenplay Writing workshop is an intensive program designed to guide aspiring screenwriters through the process of crafting compelling and marketable screenplays. This workshop provides participants with a solid foundation in screenplay structure, character development, dialogue writing, and industry-standard formatting, ensuring they are equipped to bring their stories to life on the big screen.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is ideal for beginners with little to no screenwriting experience, as well as intermediate writers looking to refine their skills. It is also suitable for novelists, playwrights, or anyone interested in exploring the craft of screenwriting.
Workshop Objectives:
- To introduce participants to the fundamentals of screenplay writing.
- To develop participants` skills in creating engaging plots and well-rounded characters.
- To enhance participants` abilities to write effective dialogue and visual storytelling.
- To familiarize participants with the screenplay industry and submission processes.
Key Components involves learning theory and practicals of: 
- Story and Character Development
- Screenplay Structure
- Dialogue Writing
- Scene Construction
- Visual Storytelling
- Formatting and Style
What does it entail:
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Writing a story based on a prompt.
- Participating in the curated feedback discussion.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Atta Galatta Book Club - Monthly Book Club
description: What have you been reading? Come, discuss your latest read. Each member gets 5-7 minutes to talk about the book, theme, plot, with 2 minutes to answer any questions others might have. Special theme of the month: Japanese Literature.

name: Risking Delight with Kedarnath Singh's "कुदाल" (Shovel) - Poetry Reading and Discussion
description:
Dwelling on new possibilities, Risking Delight explores poetry juxtaposed with joy and despair, sound and language, body and movement, thought and discovery, then life and death, via means of close-reading as guided by the legacy of the poet, Jack Gilbert.
Recipient of the Deepankar Khiwani Memorial Prize 2022 and Longlisted for the 2024 TOTO Funds the Arts Award for Poetry, Tuhin Bhowal’s poems and translations appear or are forthcoming in Bad Lilies, Poetry at Sangam, Oxford Anthology of Translation 2022, Commonwealth Writers UK, Parentheses Journal, and elsewhere. Tuhin lives alone in Bangalore.

name: Raj Natyanjali - Classical Dance Recital
description:
Mani Nata Raja Nrithya Pradhesham in association with Atta Galatta Presents a classical dance recital for a cause, in the memory of the fur angels, where 50 percent of raised fund will be donated for animal welfare.
The classical evening showcases 2 styles, the wonderful vibrant Bharathanatyam and Beauty of elegant Mohiniyattam. The curator Shri Manimaran Ilangovan along with his disciples Smt.Deepu, Smt.Sonika, Kum.Bavya, Kum.Aura, Kum. Aruthira, Kum.Yazhmozhi, Kum.Raina bring this memorable event for you. Smt.Sindhuja Radhakrishnan and Smt.Rashmi Chauhan shall be hosting the event.

name: Panchatantra for Adults - Object Based Storytelling Performance
description: Timeless tales from one of the most travelled Indian lores created for adults but over time diluted and forgotten, that speaks about human psychology, emotional strength, decision making, relationships, strategy and administration. Peppered with folk songs, miniature indigenous crafts objects on flora and fauna from various parts of the country, the performance travels through the many tantras chapter by chapter touching on the wisdom and timeless. Elephants, Tigers, Donkeys etc: Humans Animals and Metaphors.

name: Coffee and Conversations - Group Meetup
description:
What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.
We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.
After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!
Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.
Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.
Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.
Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.
Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.
Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.
Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.
Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Sunday Morning with Authors - Book Discussion
description:
You are cordially invited to a discussion on two riveting books; the first, Moving Fingers: Writers on Writing, has contributors like Zac O’Yeah, Anjum Hasan and others talking about the art and craft of writing various genres. The second, Autumn Blossoms, is an exceptional book of stories around women by Gajra Kottary. She has also contributed to the former book, mentioned above.
This discussion will include prolific authors Shinie Antony, Shabbeer Ahmed, Gajra Kottary, Zac O’Yeah and Anjum Hasan, and will be moderated by Shantanu Ray Chaudhuri.

name: Oil Painting Workshop - Art Workshop
description:
Come, join me for an oil painting workshop. If this is your first dabble with paints, this fun and interactive step by step session is sure to keep you entertained, and provide the guidance for a canvas of your own creation. All the necessary materials will be provided. The only thing that you’re expected to bring along is your enthusiasm and art vibes.
Art is an expression of the inner self and the world around us as we perceive it. Oil paints provide beautiful rich textures and add depth and substance to the subject.
The essence of this session is to get together and create artistic strokes that unite us in a bond of communal love and creativity.

name: An Evening of Magic - Magic Show
description: An Evening of Magic is a most amazing magic show presented by `Nakul Shenoy & Friends`, featuring top entertainers and magic acts. Curated and hosted by the internationally-acclaimed mentalist Nakul Shenoy, each event in this series brings unique acts and performances by nationally and internationally acclaimed magicians, alongside some of the most notable up-and-coming stars of magic. This is an evening that is truly magical, and one you will want to experience many times over.

name: Life Activation Workshop - Wellness Workshop
description:
Personalized Acupuncture via touch & Guided Meditation for physical and emotional healing.
We are powered by the Life Force that sustains the Universe. We don`t just live on the surface of this planet, we are deeply integrated within its energy fields.  The Elemental Energies of Earth, Air, Water & Fire power and protect all living beings in this world, including us - helping us flourish and grow - mind, body and soul.  When these Elemental Energies are in proper balance, our bodies are dis-ease free, our emotions are clear and our minds are powerfully activated. 
How will this workshop help you? 
You will be provided with an Acupuncture treatment customized based on your individual pulse & energy reading. This will channel the elemental energy within your body and mind - to heal you physically and mentally. (No needles involved).
Guiding you through powerful ‘Shadow Work’ and ‘741 Sound Healing Meditation’ to access the deepest parts of your soul, releasing any repressed emotional pain & healing them. 
Providing you with tips and techniques that can be incorporated in your daily life to live in balance within yourself and the world around you. 
You will be leaving this workshop feeling emotionally balanced, mentally powerful and healed in body & soul – with a renewed appreciation for your magnificent self. 
Who are the healers conducting the workshop?
Dimpy Fadhya is a wellbeing & spiritual therapist. An intuitive tarot and energy reader, crystal healer. Successfully conducted many workshops with miraculous transformations in participants` lives. She has travelled worldly using and putting her knowledge, wisdom, gifts and skills to uplift the consciousness of the collective. As a channeller she connects you to your higher self to help you find answers and receive guided messages towards your life purpose. 
Benazir is an Acupuncture therapist certified by Bharat Sevak Samaj. She is an MBA from ISB, Hyderabad who discovered the power of Acupuncture to heal body & mind via a personal awakening, which moved her to step away from the corporate world to focus on holistic healing practices that help her clients flourish in all aspects of life.

name: Puppy Adoption Drive - Adoption Drive
description: Join us for a cute and cuddly puppy adoption drive! Puppies aided by Let’s Live Together, an NGO that initiated Bangalore’s first foster-based rescue program for orphaned puppies, will be available for you to interact with, and to take home for fostering / adoption. Come by to Atta Galatta anytime between 11 AM and 5 PM on 27th July, Saturday.

name: Pen & Latte 3.0 - Writers Group
description:
Atta Galatta and Aristotle’s Writers Club cordially invite you to the latest Writers Meetup in town.
Join fellow wordsmiths and storytellers for an inspiring afternoon of creativity at our Writers Club Meet event in the cozy ambiance of the library cafe. Whether you`re a seasoned author, aspiring novelist, or just passionate about penning your thoughts, this gathering is your opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals. Unleash your creativity and let your words flow in the company of kindred spirits at our Writers Club Meet.
Bring along your notebook, laptop or tablet and delve into a shared writing experience.
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Writing a story based on a prompt.
Participating in the curated feedback discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolizing the conversation.
performer:
Aparajita Sharma, 
Your View On Books,

name: The Write Step - Writers Group
description:
The Write Step is a writers’ support group that hopes to foster and grow a community of writers who meet once a month to talk about the myriad aspects of writing. Writers in the making who haven’t published or written yet are most welcome. The aim is to devise a support group that sparks creativity.
While each meeting will be around a certain predefined subject matter pertaining to the craft, there will be time set aside for the group to address individual queries.

name: Dear Me - Inner Child Letter Writing Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and Dr. Divyanshi warmly invite you to a transformative Inner Child Letter Writing Workshop called "Dear Me". 
Imagine a time, when you were a kid and felt carefree and full of wonder, unburdened by the weight of the world. We all carry pieces of our childhood within us. We all are simply children with responsibilities. However, sometimes, life experiences can hold us back.
Through inner child work you can uncover buried emotions and release old wounds. This Inner Child Letter Writing Workshop is designed to help you reconnect with that part of yourself, guiding you through self-reflection and emotional healing. Learn to let go of the past, embrace self-compassion, and unlock your full potential. Leave feeling lighter, empowered, and ready to move forward with confidence. Our Inner Child Letter Writing Workshop is a unique and nurturing program designed to help participants reconnect with their inner child through the powerful medium of letter writing. This workshop aims to foster self-compassion, inner growth, and a deeper understanding of one`s past experiences, providing a safe space for personal reflection and healing.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is perfect for anyone above 16 years of age seeking to heal past wounds, foster self-compassion, or explore their inner emotional landscape. It is also suitable for anyone interested in the therapeutic benefits of letter writing. You don`t need any sort of prior experience. 
Workshop Objectives:
- To guide participants in reconnecting with their inner child.
- To develop participants` skills in reflective and expressive writing.
- To enhance participants` abilities to identify and articulate past experiences.
- To foster a supportive and compassionate community for personal growth.
Key Components:
- Understanding the Inner Child: Delving into the concept and significance of the inner child in healing.
- Reflective Writing: Techniques and exercises to help participants access and express their inner thoughts and feelings.
- Guided Letter Writing: Step-by-step guidance on writing compassionate and healing letters to one`s inner child.
- Sharing and Feedback: Creating a safe space for participants to share their letters and receive supportive feedback.
What Does It Entail:
- Ice Breaker Activity: Engaging in an introductory exercise to foster connection and openness among participants.
- Guided Meditation & Visualization: A short session to help participants access a reflective and relaxed state.
- Letter Writing Session: Composing a heartfelt letter to one`s inner child.
- Curated Feedback Discussion: Participating in a supportive group discussion to share insights and experiences.
- Following Community Guidelines: Ensuring a respectful and nurturing environment for all participants.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
ONLY 5 SEATS AVAILABLE. The intention is to keep the space as intimate as possible for exclusive experience, comfortable sharing, enhanced space for self-reflection, and personalised attention. 
Please bring your own journals and pens!

name: Wandering Thoughts - Listener's Circle - Women's Support Group
description:
Atta Galatta and fallenphoenix2fly warmly invite you to our Women Support Group Meet, a safe and supportive gathering dedicated to providing emotional support and fostering a sense of community among women. Join us for an evening of connection, sharing, and mutual support in the comforting ambiance of our library café. This event is designed to create a judgment-free zone where women can be themselves and share their experiences openly.
Event Structure:
Introduction Session: Participants introduce themselves to the group.
Icebreaker Game: A fun and engaging game to help participants get familiar with each other.
Listening Session: Each participant is given the opportunity to share what they are going through. This segment emphasizes silent support, without offering advice, to create a safe and non-judgmental space.
Positive Action Segment: After the emotional sharing session, we engage in an uplifting activity to provide positive reinforcement and soothe the soul.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- Respect each other's experiences and maintain confidentiality.
- Provide silent support and refrain from offering unsolicited advice.
- While one person is sharing their story, participants should refrain from interrupting. We will allow each person to share in turn, and if anyone wishes to respond or provide support, they will have their chance during their turn.

name: Think The Luna Way - Book Launch
description:
“Think the Luna way" process is crafted especially for you. Formulated at Threadality Technologies, "Think the Luna way" was born from a thorough analysis of the pitfalls encountered during our product development cycles. This process ensures no feature is left behind and helps you build a strong foundation for your ideas before you even start building them.
"Think the Luna way" is more than just a guide; it’s a journey through the innovative process that revolutionized how Threadality Technologies approaches product development. Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, this book provides the insights and tools you need to refine your creative and development processes.
Mukundh Bhushan is the founder and CEO of Threadality Technologies. His entrepreneurial journey began in a college dorm room at the age of 19, where he had to manage every aspect of his IT business on his own. This experience, though challenging, laid the foundation for his future success. Mukundh has navigated the complex world of entrepreneurship by teaching and training himself, overcoming numerous challenges along the way. His book is a reflection of his ongoing journey, sharing invaluable lessons on showcasing work, recruiting and managing teams, and most importantly, efficient thinking.
In "Think the Luna way" you will learn about a comprehensive process that guarantees no feature is left behind. The book emphasizes the importance of building a solid foundation for your ideas before diving into the actual creation. Mukundh shares his insights on efficient thinking and effective strategies, a skill critical for any entrepreneur or innovator. The book is filled with real-life lessons and practical advice drawn from Mukundh’s personal experiences in starting and growing a successful tech company.
Join us for the launch of "Think the Luna way" and embark on a transformative journey that will empower you to turn your ideas into reality. The event will take place on 28th July between 1:30 to 2:30 PM in the afternoon.
Get ready to redefine your approach to design and development with "Think the Luna way" by Mukundh Bhushan!

name: Poetic Musings - Book Launch
description:
"Poetic Musings" by Dr. Padmashree R P invites readers on an enchanting journey through the human experience. This collection weaves a tapestry of diverse themes, from the paradox of freedom to the life-giving power of rain, from storytelling magic to rediscovering latent talents. Dr. Padmashree's verses resonate with collective strength and civic duty, urging readers to explore their inner depths.
The standout poem, "The Whispering Attic," poignantly explores time's passage and the desire to rekindle dormant passions. It serves as a metaphor for the hidden treasures of knowledge and talent within us all.
A central theme is the profound interconnectedness of all things. The poems illuminate the delicate threads binding humans, nature, and the cosmos, fostering a sense of unity and shared destiny.
These verses are catalysts for introspection and personal growth, challenging readers to reflect deeply on their experiences and inspiring a renewed appreciation for life's complexities. Join us to launch this exhilarating work on Sunday, 28th July, at 7.30 PM.
Dr. Padmashree R. P. is an accomplished teacher trainer and Karnataka Educational Services Officer with over 33 years of extensive experience in the education sector. She is also a passionate Academic writer, poet and story writer.

name: Kuch Kehta Hai Yeh Saawan - Kannada, Hindi and Marathi Music Performance
description:
The Trio singing group will present an evening of soulful woven tunes, film compositions celebrating monsoon season, infused with poetry through this curated concert providing a holistic and culturally enriching experience. They will be accompanied by Rohit Kumar, leading Keyboard artist.        
Watch the best of field perform live, feel the vibrations of music being in the same space as the performers and witnessing the expressions create a thrilling experience for all. Listen to the unheard gems featuring monsoon songs, anecdotes, trivia and poetry and immerse yourselves in a captivating musical experience, that showcases talent and artistry of featured musicians. This group showcases the versatility and creativity of musicians who skilfully incorporate freshness in their singing, bringing a new perspective to familiar/unheard tunes. It's an artistic exploration and a deeper understanding of the interplay between tradition and innovation in music.
Pratibha Kulkarni - is an Indian playback singer and a voice over artist. She is a trained Hindustani artist and has rendered several Kannada film songs and has recorded songs for many albums in multiple Indian languages including Hindi, Marathi, Kannada, Gujrati, Rajasthani and Sanskrit. 
Rajeev Anand - is a professional singer and a performer. He has performed over 400+ shows in and around Bangalore till date.
Kunal Kushwaha - is a popular singer among club gigs and has been regularly performing all over Bangalore since many years.
Rohit Kumar - Leading Keyboard Artist who has delivered fantastic music across all concerts in Bangalore music circuit today.
Dr. Kavita - Anchor, Actress by passion and Doctor by profession who's been anchoring several leading concerts and events.
performer:
Kunal Kushwaha, 
Pratibha Kulkarni, 
Rajeev Anand, 
Rohit Kumar,

name: Wandering Thoughts - Listener's Circle - Women's Support Group
description:
Atta Galatta and fallenphoenix2fly warmly invite you to our Women Support Group Meet, a safe and supportive gathering dedicated to providing emotional support and fostering a sense of community among women. Join us for an evening of connection, sharing, and mutual support in the comforting ambiance of our library café. This event is designed to create a judgment-free zone where women can be themselves and share their experiences openly.
Event Structure:
Introduction Session: Participants introduce themselves to the group.
Icebreaker Game: A fun and engaging game to help participants get familiar with each other.
Listening Session: Each participant is given the opportunity to share what they are going through. This segment emphasizes silent support, without offering advice, to create a safe and non-judgmental space.
Positive Action Segment: After the emotional sharing session, we engage in an uplifting activity to provide positive reinforcement and soothe the soul.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- Respect each other's experiences and maintain confidentiality.
- Provide silent support and refrain from offering unsolicited advice.
- While one person is sharing their story, participants should refrain from interrupting. We will allow each person to share in turn, and if anyone wishes to respond or provide support, they will have their chance during their turn.

name: Chapter Carnival 2.0 - Literary Meetup
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View On Books, A Novel Club cordially invite you to the latest Library Meetup in town.
Join us for a innovative Library Meet wherein there`s over hundreds of books and you could pick a book in random and start reading together.
Have an enriching evening of literary discussion and camaraderie at our Book Club Meet event! Engage in lively conversations, exchange recommendations, and bond over our mutual love for literature. Don`t miss out on this opportunity to connect with fellow book enthusiasts and expand your literary horizons!
Come along with Empty Minds and fill it with rich literature from Atta Galatta’s Reading Section.
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Reading minimum one chapter from a random book that you choose from the libary.
Participating in the ensuing curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolizing the conversation.

name: Don't Stop Acting 1.0 - Acting Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and MWM MOVIES cordially invite you to the latest Acting Workshop in town. 
Join fellow aspiring actors and actresses for an inspiring session of learning acting through basics at our Writers Club Meet event in the cozy ambiance of the library cafe. Our Acting workshop is designed for aspiring artists who wish to explore the fundamentals of acting and develop their performance skills in a supportive and engaging environment. This immersive workshop offers participants a thorough grounding in acting techniques, character development, and scene work, providing them with the tools needed to bring authenticity and depth to their performances.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is ideal for beginners with little to no acting experience, as well as intermediate actors looking to refresh their skills. It is also suitable for anyone interested in improving their public speaking and presentation abilities.
Workshop Objectives:
- To introduce participants to the basic principles of acting.
- To develop participants` abilities to create believable and compelling characters.
- To enhance participants` skills in scene study and script analysis.
- To build participants` confidence in performing in front of an audience.
Key Components involves learning theory and practicals of: 
- Acting Techniques
- Character Development and Analysis
- SCript Analysis and Interpretation
- Understanding Director`s Vision
- Conveying Emotions
- Physicality and Movement of Camera
- Improvization and Spontaneity
- Voice and Diction
- Working with Props and Costumes
- Rehearsals and Performances
What does it entail:
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Participating in workshop with enthusiasm.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.
